SEARCH
Package executor.service.service.step

Interface StepExecution

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractStepExecution, StepExecutionClickCss, StepExecutionClickXpath, StepExecutionSleep
public interface StepExecution
Interface representing the execution logic for a specific step action within a scenario.

The StepExecution interface defines the contract for classes responsible for executing steps with specific actions, such as clicking elements or waiting for a certain duration. Implementing classes should provide the concrete logic for executing a step based on a particular step action.

Implementing classes must also implement the getStepAction() method to return the specific action associated with the step execution logic. The returned action serves as an identifier for the type of step to be executed.

The step(WebDriver, Step) method takes a WebDriver instance and a Step object as parameters, allowing access to the web browser context and the details of the step to be executed. It returns a StepResult indicating the outcome of the step execution, including the execution status and any relevant details or error messages.

This interface promotes a flexible and extensible design for handling diverse step actions within a scenario, allowing for the creation of various StepExecution implementations tailored to specific step actions.

Important: Implementations should be designed to be stateless and thread-safe since they may be reused across multiple step executions.

See Also:

  • WebDriver

  • Method Details

    • getStepAction

      String getStepAction()
      Gets the specific step action associated with the step execution logic.

      The getStepAction method is responsible for returning the identifier of the step action associated with the implementing class. This identifier serves as a key or label for the type of step action the class is designed to execute.

      This method allows for easy categorization and recognition of different step action types within the broader context of scenario execution.

      Returns:
      The step action as a String.

    • step

      StepResult step(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver webDriver, Step step)
      Executes a step based on the provided WebDriver and Step parameters, returning a StepResult indicating the outcome of the execution.

      The step method is responsible for executing a step with a specific action using the provided WebDriver instance and Step details. It encapsulates the logic for performing the action associated with the step and returns a StepResult indicating the outcome, including the execution status and any relevant details or error messages.

      This method serves as the core execution point for individual steps within a scenario, allowing for diverse step actions to be handled by different implementations of the StepExecution interface.

      Parameters:
      webDriver - The WebDriver instance representing the web browser context.
      step - The Step object containing details of the step to be executed.
      Returns:
      A StepResult representing the outcome of the step execution.
      See Also:
      • StepResult
      • Step
      • WebDriver
